lines.text: An American making love is like a Hungarian playing baseball.

[to the irate members of the women's club]
Spine snappers! You don't want my poetry. You want my liver!

[to Koocker]
I can't write poetry in jail. I've tried!

[about Leonard]
That mench! He's got a heart as black as the ace of diamonds!
The words of Mercury are hard after the songs of Apollo.
Hey, Samson, Mr. Butler's got some great news for you!
Mister? When did he get the operation?

[Apologetically to Butler]
He doesn't mean anything.
